data.title: Repsol, S.A. reports Q3 results
data.description:
• Repsol, S.A. press release (REPYY): Q3 Adjusted Income reached €820M, up 47% year-over-year; Net Income was €574M, up 246% year-over-year.
  • 3Q25 EBITDA was €1,935M, up 36% year-over-year; 9M25 EBITDA totaled €5,013M.
  • Free cash flow in Q3 2025 was €998M, €847M higher than Q3 2024, mainly due to lower net capex.
  • Net debt at quarter-end was €6.9B, up €1,162M from Q2 2025, mainly due to the NEO Energy merger; gearing at 20.5%.
  • 3Q25 Adjusted Income reached €820M, up 47% year-over-year; Net Income was €574M, up 246% year-over-year.

data.title: Evaxion raises $7.2 million, extending cash runway to second half of 2027
data.description:
• Evaxion A/S (EVAX) now has cash on hand to fund its operations and R&D programs into the second half of 2027, extended from the first half of 2027, the company said on Thursday.
  • In total, Evaxion has raised $7.2 million recently, with $4.5 million coming from the sale of shares in an at-the-market (ATM) offering and $2.7 million coming from the exercise of investor warrants.
  • Total gross inflow of cash of $14.7 million since the end of the second quarter 2025.

data.title: Alnylam Pharmaceuticals beats top-line and bottom-line estimates; updates FY outlook
data.description:
• Alnylam Pharmaceuticals press release (ALNY): Q3 Non-GAAP EPS of $2.90 beats by $1.15.
  • Revenue of $1.24B (+147.5% Y/Y) beats by $265.88M.
  • Cash, cash equivalents and marketable securities were $2.7 billion as of September 30, 2025, as compared to $2.9 billion as of June 30, 2025, with the decrease primarily driven by the partial repurchase of the 1.00% convertible senior notes due 2027, offset in part by net proceeds from the issuance of 0.00% convertible senior notes due 2028 and net cash inflows from operating activities.

  • 2025 Financial Guidance

    Full-year 2025 financial guidance is updated and consists of the following:

    Updated FY 2025 Guidance

    $475 million - $525 million

    Reiterate FY guidance

    Total net product revenues

    $2,950 million - $3,050 million (vs. consensus of $3.57B)

data.title: Kellanova Non-GAAP EPS of $0.94 beats by $0.07, revenue of $3.26B beats by $10M
data.description:
• Kellanova press release (K): Q3 Non-GAAP EPS of $0.94 beats by $0.07.
  • Revenue of $3.26B (+0.9% Y/Y) beats by $10M.
  • Due to the pending merger with Mars, Incorporated, Kellanova will not be providing forward-looking guidance.

data.title: Talkspace GAAP EPS of $0.02 in-line, revenue of $59.4M beats by $1.95M
data.description:
• Talkspace press release (TALK): Q3 GAAP EPS of $0.02 in-line.
  • Revenue of $59.4M (+25.3% Y/Y) beats by $1.95M.

  • Financial Guidance

    The following guidance is based on current market conditions and expectations and the information available to the Company today. For 2025 Talkspace has updated its guidance as follows:

    • Revenue to be in the range of $226 million to $230 million (updated from $220 million - $235 million)
    • Adjusted EBITDA to be in the range of $14 million to $16 million (updated from $14 million - $20 million)

data.title: Gannett GAAP EPS of -$0.27 misses by $0.15, revenue of $560.8M misses by $10.23M
data.description:
• Gannett press release (GCI): Q3 GAAP EPS of -$0.27 misses by $0.15.
  • Revenue of $560.8M (-8.4% Y/Y) misses by $10.23M.
  • Total digital revenues of $262.7 million, 46.9% of total revenues
  • Full Year 2025 Business Outlook(4)
    • Total digital revenues are expected to decline in the low single digits on a same store basis(1) and are expected to make up 50%+ of total revenues during 2026
      • We expect fourth quarter total digital revenues to grow in the low single digits on a same store basis(1)
    • Total revenues are expected to be down in the low-mid single digits on a same store basis(1) leading to flat same store revenue trends(1) in early 2026
    • Net income attributable to Gannett is expected to improve compared to the prior year
    • Total Adjusted EBITDA is expected to grow versus the prior year
    • Cash provided by operating activities is expected to grow in excess of 30% versus the prior year
    • Free cash flow(1) is expected to grow in excess(6) of 30% versus the prior year, reflecting near-term cash required to implement cost reduction initiatives

data.title: HF Sinclair weighing pipeline expansions to boost West Coast fuel supply
data.description:
HF Sinclair (DINO) said late Wednesday it is considering a multi-phase expansion of its midstream refined products network across the Rocky Mountain and West Coast regions, as it seeks to address widening fuel supply imbalances following multiple refinery closures in the western U.S. that have caused a scramble to source alternative means of supply.

HF Sinclair (DINO) said its "current geographic footprint and infrastructure provide an advantaged position to quickly and efficiently deliver refined products where the market needs are strongest."

The planned closures of Phillips 66 and Valero Energy refineries in California are set to wipe out ~20% of the state's fuel requirements, which also help meet the needs of neighboring states.

HF Sinclair (DINO) said the proposed multi-phased expansion projects under review could enable incremental supply of up to 150,000 bbl/day of product into various markets, subject to board and regulatory approvals.

The first phase of the plan, targeted for completion in 2028, would expand capacity by a projected 35,000 bbl/day to move additional supply from its Rockies production into Nevada and is expected to be online in 2028.

The first phase, targeted for completion in 2028, would expand capacity by approximately 35,000 bpd to move additional supply from Wyoming into Nevada; this stage includes expansion of the Pioneer Pipeline joint venture with Phillips 66 from Sinclair, Wyoming, to Salt Lake City, Utah, as well as debottlenecking of the UNEV Pipeline between Salt Lake City and Las Vegas.

The company said it is also reviewing its Medicine Bow, Pioneer and UNEV pipelines for a possible expansion.

HF Sinclair (DINO) +1.2% pre-market Thursday after reporting better than expected Q3 adjusted earnings, helped by improved refining margins and strength in its midstream segment.

data.title: Earnings Snapshot: Cheniere Energy tops Q3 EPS estimates, but misses on revenue; updates FY DCF outlook

Roblox reports Q3 results
data.description:
• Roblox press release (RBLX): Q3 Net loss of $257M
  • Revenue of $1.4B (+23.9% Y/Y) misses by $300M.
